questions.question: Humanism promoted the study of classical works that stimulated exploration of science.

questions.question: Which statement best show how the Scientific Revolution changed the way people perceived nature and society?

choices.answer: People used new tech discoveries only to develop their own economy
the scientific method,empiricism,and experimentation were applied to life
People started associating religion with science
People applied the belief of the classical scientists to develop philosophy

choices.answer: People used new tech discoveries only to develop their own economy
People challenged the accepted “scientific truths” taught by the church.

choices.answer: For an economy to work , it shouldn’t have to serve any moral goal

questions.question: Which two events in Britain indirectly influenced the American Revolution?

choices.answer: passage of the English Bill of Rights,The Glorious Revolution
the English Peasant Revolution,the election of commoners to Parliament

questions.question: Which statement about the social demographics of the colonies is true?

choices.answer: The colonies were settled by people following a single religion.
Europeans from many countries settled in the colonies.
Only British people could settle in the colonies.
Europeans stopped coming to the colonies because of war.

questions.question: Why was the Tennis Court Oath a significant event of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: It solidified the people’s resolve for constitutional reforms.
It forced King Louis XVI and his family to flee Versailles
It encouraged several nobles to join the National Assembly
t sought to strengthen and empower French women

questions.question: What was an effect of the lack of representation of the third estate in the Estates-General?

choices.answer: the king’s dismissal of the clergy from the Estates-General
seizing of lands of the members of the first estate
formation of the first National Assembly
decreased power of the nobles in the Estates-General

questions.question: In what two ways did Napoleon influence France during his reign?

choices.answer: He promoted public education funded by the government.
He formed strategic partnerships with the United States and England.
He created many advanced war weapons and artillery.
He declared Christianity the state religion of France.

questions.question: How did the success of the American Revolution contribute to the French Revolution?

choices.answer: made the French vulnerable to attacks, invasions, and threats from the US
led the French to seek an alliance with the Americans to dethrone Louis XVI
encouraged the French to adopt the government system of popular sovereignty
inspired the French to launch their own revolution for liberty & equality

questions.question: Napoleon improved the education system by creating lycées, whose purpose was prepare male candidates for government jobs

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: How did the French Revolution help Napoleon rise to power as an able military and political leader in France?

choices.answer: Britain was looking for a French ally to overturn the revolution
France's government both wanted a neutral leader whom they hoped to control
established Napoleon as a military hero famous for his victories
French generals were eager to make one of their own the leader of France

questions.question: Which of the following steps did the Congress of Vienna take to build political relations among countries?

choices.answer: The Congress made Spain the most powerful nation in Europe.
The Congress strengthened the major powers against France.
The Congress gave Britain complete political control of France.
The Congress divided republics in the regions Napoleon had conquered.

questions.question: How did Napoleon's loss in the Battle of Trafalgar affect Europe?

choices.answer: Napoleon and his forces no longer attempted to invade Britain
Napoleon tried to win Russia as an ally to defeat Britain.
Napoleon used Prussia & Spain’s support to again attack the British forces
Napoleon gave up his plans to expand French control across the Atlantic

questions.question: Which statement describes economic or social factors that led to Latin American revolutions?

choices.answer: Slaves in Haiti revolted against plantation owners.
